parameters.name: {USER}
parameters.description: The name of the user you wish to retrieve a feed from

notes: Provides an RSS feed of a specified ASKfm users answers.

parameters.name: {ID}
parameters.description: The BR player ID, or Steam64 ID of the player.

qs.name: options={OPTIONS}
qs.description: A comma-separated list of options. Available options can be listed if you specify list instead of {OPTIONS}. Similarly, specifying default will list the default options.

notes: Returns stats from the leaderboards API about the player.

parameters.name: {CHANNEL}
parameters.description: The channel to retrieve BetterTTV emotes for

notes: Returns a space-separated list of BetterTTV channel emotes available in the channel.

qs.name: search={SEARCH}
qs.description: {SEARCH} the location name to search for.

notes: Searches for locations based on the search query string, and returns a location name together with a URL to the location on iZurvive.

qs.name: ip={IP_ADDRESS}
qs.description: The IP address of the server.

qs.name: port={PORT}
qs.description: The connect port of the server.

qs.name: query={QUERY_PORT}
qs.description: The query port of the server.

notes: Queries the specified DayZ server and returns a player count in format of: {PLAYERCOUNT}/{MAXPLAYERS}
Note: This also works with other games, such as Miscreated.
Retrieves the latest status report from the DayZ website.
Retrieves the latest status report from the DayZ news section on Steam.

qs.name: key={API_KEY}
qs.description: Your custom API key

qs.name: limit={NUMBER}
qs.description: The limit of list entries - Max: 100

notes: This is just an example note.

qs.name: limit={NUMBER}
qs.description: The limit of list entries

notes: Retrieves information about the user.
Returns an RSS feed of the latest Twitch jobs listings.

qs.name: exp
qs.description: The mathematic expression to receive the result from.

qs.name: round
qs.description: If specified, it will round to the nearest whole number, but only if there is no value specified or the value specified is 0 or less. Default: 0 (if specified with no value).

notes: Performs a mathematic operation based on the expression passed to the endpoint.

qs.name: from
qs.description: The currency code you are converting from.

qs.name: to
qs.description: The currency code you want to convert to.

qs.name: value
qs.description: The amount of 'from' you wish to convert.

qs.name: round
qs.description: The amount of decimals you wish to round the currency to. Default: 2.

qs.name: list
qs.description: If this is included in the request, a comma-separated list of available currencies will be listed instead.

notes: Converts from one currency to another..
The currency codes follow the ISO 4217 standard.
The API used for currency conversions is Fixer.io.

qs.name: offset
qs.description: How many patch notes you want to skip back in history

notes: Retrieves the latest Rainbow Six: Siege patch notes from the Ubisoft forums.

parameters.name: {MIN}
parameters.description: The minimum number the result can be - Default: 0.

parameters.name: {MAX}
parameters.description: The maximum number the result can be - Default: 100.

qs.name: format
qs.description: If specified, number will be formatted using the default options of number_format()

notes: Picks a random number between {MIN} and {MAX}.
This only uses rand() and should not be if you want a "truly random" number.
Lists currencies available on Steam (3-letter code + full name)
Send the header Accept: application/json to retrieve a JSON object.

parameters.name: {STEAM_ID}
parameters.description: The Steam64 ID of the user. See: steamid.co

parameters.name: readable
parameters.description: This has to be passed as just readable and nothing else to have any effect. It formats the time to a more "human-readable" format. For example: 190.97 hours = 7 days 22 hours 58 minutes.

qs.name: round
qs.description: How many decimals the hours should round to - Default: 2.

qs.name: key
qs.description: A custom Steam API key. In some cases this is necessary to retrieve profile information about private/friends-only profiles.

notes: Retrieves the player's time played in the specified game (app ID).
The Steam API key can be retrieved here: https://steamcommunity.com/dev/

parameters.name: {STEAM_ID}
parameters.description: The Steam64 ID of the user. See: steamid.co

notes: Retrieves the gameserver information of the user, if available.
This only works for certain games and only if the user's profile is set to public.
Lists the currently available endpoints - Returns a JSON object

parameters.name: {CHANNEL}
parameters.description: The channel name to retrieve the chat rules for.

notes: Gives a "newlined" list of chat rules for the specified channel.

parameters.name: {CHANNEL}
parameters.description: The channel to check chat cluster for.

notes: Retrieves the chat cluster name for the channel specified.
Note that this is essentially useless from now on, as all requests will (most likely) return aws.

parameters.name: {CHANNEL}
parameters.description: The name of the channel. Will only be used for reference.

qs.name: subscribers
qs.description: The amount of subscribers, used for calculating how many subscribers are needed to get the next amount of emote slots.

parameters.name: {CHANNEL}
parameters.description: The channel name that will be used as reference for checking the "follow age".

parameters.name: {USER}
parameters.description: The name of the user that you wish to check the "follow age" for.

qs.name: precision
qs.description: How precise the timestamp should be in terms of years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes & seconds.- Default: 2.

notes: Gets the time difference (also known as the "follow age") between when {USER} followed {CHANNEL}
Retrieves the date and time of when the user followed the channel.
Example format: Mar 13. 2016 - 07:31:29 PM (UTC)

parameters.name: {CHANNEL}
parameters.description: The channel name of the channel you wish to retrieve followers for.

qs.name: count
qs.description: How many followers to get with the request. Default: 1. Max: 100.

qs.name: offset
qs.description: How many followers to offset from the beginning of the object.

qs.name: direction
qs.description: What direction to retrieve followers in. Can either be 'asc' or 'desc'. Default: 'desc'.

qs.name: num
qs.description: Prefixes each follower with a number.

notes: Retrieves the current game the channel has been set to.

parameters.name: {SEARCH}
parameters.description: The string to search for in the titles of the help articles.

qs.name: list
qs.description: If this is specified at all, a list of available help articles will be returned instead.

notes: Allows you to search help article titles and return the full title + URL.
JSON results are supported for most requests (search + help articles).
Retrieves the latest "highlight" of the specified channel.

qs.name: display_name
qs.description: If specified, this will use the display names instead of the usernames of the users that are hosting.

qs.name: list
qs.description: If specified, the list will be in plaintext (using newlines) instead of in a JSON object.

qs.name: implode
qs.description: If specified, the list will be returned comma-separated (", ") instead of JSON/a "newlined" list.

notes: Returns a list of channel names hosting the specified channel.
JSON results are returned by default. See list/implode query string..
Returns the Twitch user ID of the specified user (if valid).
Returns a formatted list of available ingest servers.

parameters.name: {STREAMS}
parameters.description: A space-separated list of streams to generate a multi link with.

qs.name: streams
qs.description: Can be used as an alternative to the {STREAMS} route parameter.

qs.name: service
qs.description: Chooses which multistream service you want to use. Specify something bogus for this parameter to get a list of available services. Default: "multistream".

notes: Generates a "multi stream" URL based on the channel names passed to it.
While the streams query parameter is optional, you have to specify the streams as either a route parameter or as the streams query parameter.
Retrieves the subscriber count of the specified channel.
This only works for channels that have authenticated and authorized this app.
Retrieves the subscriber emotes for the specified channels and lists them (space-separated).
JSON results are supported.
Retrieves the current title set on the channel.

qs.name: sort
qs.description: If this is specified, it will sort the members of the team alphabetically.

qs.name: text
qs.description: If this is specified, the list will be returned in plaintext compared to a JSON array.

notes: Retrieves the members of a specified team.
The team identifier is the identifier used in URLs. Example: The team "New Game Plus" has the identifier "newgameplus".
JSON results are returned by default. See text query string..
Works identical to status - Retrieves the current title set on the channel.
Returns the latest uploaded video (title + URL) for the specified channel.
Returns how long the specified channel has been live for the current broadcast.
Rate-limited: This is rate-limited to 100 requests per minute.

qs.name: no_rts
qs.description: If specified, retweets will not be included.

qs.name: include_replies
qs.description: If specified at all, this includes replies from the specified user to other users as well.

qs.name: no_exclude_replies
qs.description: Works similarly to include_replies, except this query string cannot be specified as just empty unlike include_replies.

qs.name: search
qs.description: Goes through each of the latest tweets (up to 200) and then searches with the specified string (case-insensitive). If this is not specified, it will just return the latest tweet.

qs.name: strict
qs.description: This is used together with search. If specified, it will do a case-sensitive search.

qs.name: url
qs.description: If specified, the URL of the tweet will be appended to the result.

qs.name: shorten
qs.description: Used together with url. Shortens the URL using TinyURL.

qs.name: howlong
qs.description: Includes the time since the tweet was posted.

notes: Returns the latest tweet by the specified user.
Works exactly like latest, except this will not include the tweet text and by default only include the URL.
Works exactly like latest, except this will only include the tweet ID and nothing else.

qs.name: user
qs.description: For users with URLs that are formatted like: youtube.com/user/[USERNAME_HERE].

qs.name: id
qs.description: For users with URLs that are formatted like: youtube.com/channel/[ID_HERE].

qs.name: skip
qs.description: Skips the specified amount of uploads. - Default: 0. - Maximum: 50.

notes: Retrieves the latest video uploaded to the specified channel and returns the title + URL for it.
Either user or id has to be specified. If both are specified, id will be used.

qs.name: id
qs.description: The ID of the playlist. You can find it in the URL when browsing the playlist after list=.

notes:
Important: Because of a bit of a limitation with the YouTube API, the owner of the playlist has to go into the "Playlist settings" and order the playlist by "Date added/published (newest)" for this to work correctly.
Screenshot
Retrieves the latest video added to a playlist.

qs.name: show_url
qs.description: Prepends https://youtu.be/ before the video ID to make it a proper URL.

notes: Searches the YouTube API with the specified string and returns the first result it can find (if any).
If the search string is a valid video ID, it will just return the video ID.
